intro: Pedicularis cranolopha var. garnieri, commonly known as the Garnier's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in alpine botany.
